channel.title: NameQuick Updates
channel.description: Most recent changes with links to updates.

item.title: Version 2.0.11
item.description:
NameQuick v2.0.11

This update focuses on making file processing more reliable, especially for downloaded files and larger batches.

New

  • Cancel Processing (new): stop the current run instantly without creating errors.
    • What happens: the active file stops; all queued files clear; no error pop‑ups.
    • Safe to retry: cancelled files aren’t marked failed — just run again when ready.
    • Where to find it: toolbar (X), menu bar (Cancel All), batch window (Cancel All).

What’s Fixed

  • Files you download now get processed more consistently. No more wondering if that screenshot or document will show up.
  • Better handling when you drag & drop files that are already in your library. They get reprocessed without confusion.
  • Improved stability during busy periods when lots of files are being discovered at once.
  • File monitoring is more precise, catching changes that were sometimes missed before.
  • Issues button now reliably opens the Issues HUD again, so you can review and clear errors directly.

Under the Hood

  • Enhanced the way NameQuick tracks files through the processing pipeline.
  • Better coordination between different parts of the app when handling file batches.
  • More reliable database operations, especially during high-volume imports.
  • Smarter duplicate detection to avoid unnecessary work.

This should make NameQuick feel more predictable, especially if you work with lots of files or frequently download content that needs processing.

— Josef
